verses.text: Obtain with thy money such guards, for body and for soul, for whose sake a sinking ship is made buoyant, when steered by the prayers of the saints alone; and disease at its height is subdued, put to flight by the laying on of hands; and the attack of robbers is disarmed, spoiled by pious prayers; and the might of demons is crushed, put to shame in its operations by strenuous commands.

chapters.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 35

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 35:1
verses.text: 35 All these warriors and guards are trusty.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 35:2
verses.text: No one is idle, no one is useless.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 35:3
verses.text: One can obtain your pardon from God, another comfort you when sick, another weep and groan in sympathy for you to the Lord of all, another teach some of the things useful for salvation, another admonish with confidence, another counsel with kindness.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 35:4
verses.text: And all can love truly, without guile, without fear, without hypocrisy, without flattery, without pretence.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 35:5
verses.text: O sweet service of loving souls! O blessed thoughts of confident hearts! O sincere faith of those who fear God alone! O truth of words with those who cannot lie! O beauty of deeds with those who have been commissioned to serve God, to persuade God, to please God, not to touch thy flesh! to speak, but to the King of eternity dwelling in thee.

chapters.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 36

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 36:1
verses.text: 36 All the faithful, then, are good and godlike, and worthy of the name by which they are encircled as with a diadem.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 36:2
verses.text: There are, besides, some, the elect of the elect, and so much more or less distinguished by drawing themselves, like ships to the strand, out of the surge of the world and bringing themselves to safety; not wishing to seem holy, and ashamed if one call them so; hiding in the depth of their mind the ineffable mysteries, and disdaining to let their nobleness be seen in the world; whom the Word calls "the light of the world, and the salt of the earth".

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 36:3
verses.text: This is the seed, the image and likeness of God, and His true son and heir, sent here as it were on a sojourn, by the high administration and suitable arrangement of the Father, by whom the visible and invisible things of the world were created; some for their service, some for their discipline, some for their instruction; and all things are held together so long as the seed remains here; and when it is gathered, these things shall be very quickly dissolved.

chapters.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 37

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 37:1
verses.text: 37 For what further need has God of the mysteries of love? And then thou shalt look into the bosom of the Father, whom God the only-begotten Son alone hath declared.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 37:2
verses.text: And God Himself is love; and out of love to us became feminine.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 37:3
verses.text: In His ineffable essence He is Father; in His compassion to us He became Mother.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 37:4
verses.text: The Father by loving became feminine: and the great proof of this is He whom He begot of Himself; and the fruit brought forth by love is love.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 37:5
verses.text: For this also He came down.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 37:6
verses.text: For this He clothed Himself with man.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 37:7
verses.text: For this He voluntarily subjected Himself to the experiences of men, that by bringing Himself to the measure of our weakness whom He loved, He might correspondingly bring us to the measure of His own strength.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 37:8
verses.text: And about to be offered up and giving Himself a ransom, He left for us a new Covenant-testament: My love I give unto you.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 37:9
verses.text: And what and how great is it? For each of us He gave His life,—the equivalent for all.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 37:10
verses.text: This He demands from us in return for one another.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 37:11
verses.text: And if we owe our lives to the brethren, and have made such a mutual compact with the Saviour, why should we any more hoard and shut up worldly goods, which are beggarly, foreign to us and transitory? Shall we shut up from each other what after a little shall be the property of the fire? Divinely and weightily John says, "He that loveth not his brother is a murderer," the seed of Cain, a nursling of the devil.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 37:12
verses.text: He has not God's compassion.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 37:13
verses.text: He has no hope of better things.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 37:14
verses.text: He is sterile; he is barren; he is not  a branch of the ever-living supercelestial vine.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 37:15
verses.text: He is cut off; he waits the perpetual fire.

chapters.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 38

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 38:1
verses.text: 38 But learn thou the more excellent way, which Paul shows for salvation.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 38:2
verses.text: "Love seeketh not her own," but is diffused on the brother.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 38:3
verses.text: About him she is fluttered, about him she is soberly insane.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 38:4
verses.text: "Love covers a multitude of sins".

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 38:5
verses.text: "Perfect love casteth out fear".

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 38:6
verses.text: "Vaunteth not itself, is not puffed up; rejoiceth not in iniquity, but rejoiceth in the truth; beareth all things, believeth all things, hopeth all things, endureth all things.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 38:7
verses.text: Love never faileth.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 38:8
verses.text: Prophecies are done away, tongues cease, gifts of healing fail on the earth.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 38:9
verses.text: But these three abide, Faith, Hope, Love.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 38:10
verses.text: But the greatest of these is Love".

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 38:11
verses.text: And rightly.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 38:12
verses.text: For Faith departs when we are convinced by vision, by seeing God.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 38:13
verses.text: And Hope vanishes when the things hoped for come.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 38:14
verses.text: But Love comes to completion, and grows more when that which is perfect has been bestowed.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 38:15
verses.text: If one introduces it into his soul, although he be born in sins, and has done many forbidden things, he is able, by increasing love, and adopting a pure repentance, to retrieve his mistakes.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 38:16
verses.text: For let not this be left to despondency and despair by you, if you learn who the rich man is that has not a place in heaven, and what way he uses his property.

chapters.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 39

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 39:1
verses.text: 39 If one should escape the superfluity of riches, and the difficulty they interpose in the way of life, and be able to enjoy the eternal good things; but should happen, either from ignorance or involuntary circumstances, after the seal and redemption, to fall into sins or transgressions so as to be quite carried away; such a man is entirely rejected by God.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 39:2
verses.text: For to every one who has turned to God in truth, and with his whole heart, the doors are open, and the thrice-glad Father receives His truly repentant son.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 39:3
verses.text: And true repentance is to be no longer bound in the same sins for which He denounced death against Himself, but to eradicate them completely from the soul.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 39:4
verses.text: For on their extirpation God takes up His abode again in thee.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 39:5
verses.text: For it is said there is great and exceeding joy and festival in the heavens with the Father and the angels when one sinner turns and repents.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 39:6
verses.text: Wherefore also He cries, "I will have mercy, and not sacrifice".

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 39:7
verses.text: "I desire not the death, but the repentance of the sinner".

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 39:8
verses.text: "Though your sins be as scarlet wool, I will make them white as snow; though they be blacker than darkness, I will wash and make them like white wool".

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 39:9
verses.text: For it is in the power of God alone to grant the forgiveness of sins, and not to impute transgressions; since also the Lord commands us each day to forgive the repenting brethren.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 39:10
verses.text: "And if we, being evil, know to give good gifts," much more is it the nature of the Father of mercies, the good Father of all consolation, much pitying, very merciful, to be long-suffering, to wait for those who have turned.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 39:11
verses.text: And to turn is really to cease from our sins, and to look no longer behind.

chapters.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 40

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 40:1
verses.text: 40 Forgiveness of past sins, then, God gives; but of future, each one gives to himself.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 40:2
verses.text: And this is to repent, to condemn the past deeds, and beg oblivion of them from the Father, who only of all is able to undo what is done, by mercy proceeding from Him, and to blot out former sins by the dew of the Spirit.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 40:3
verses.text: "For by the state in which I find you will I judge," also, is what in each case the end of all cries aloud.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 40:4
verses.text: So that even in the case of one who has done the greatest good deeds in his life, but at the end has run headlong into wickedness, all his former pains are profitless to him, since at the catastrophe of the drama he has given up his part; while it is possible for the man who formerly led a bad and dissolute life, on afterwards repenting, to overcome in the time after repentance the evil conduct of a long time.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 40:5
verses.text: But it needs great carefulness, just as bodies that have suffered by protracted disease need regimen and special attention.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 40:6
verses.text: Thief, dost thou wish to get forgiveness? steal no more.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 40:7
verses.text: Adulterer, burn no more.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 40:8
verses.text: Fornicator, live for the future chastely.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 40:9
verses.text: Thou who hast robbed, give back, and give back more than thou tookest.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 40:10
verses.text: False witness, practice truth.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 40:11
verses.text: Perjurer, swear no more, and extirpate the rest of the passions, wrath, lust, grief, fear; that thou mayest be found at the end to have previously in this world been reconciled to the adversary.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 40:12
verses.text: It is then probably impossible all at once to eradicate inbred passions; but by God's power and human intercession, and the help of brethren, and sincere repentance, and constant care, they are corrected.

chapters.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 41

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 41:1
verses.text: 41 Wherefore it is by all means necessary for thee, who art pompous, and powerful, and rich, to set over thyself some man of God as a trainer and governor.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 41:2
verses.text: Reverence, though it be but one man; fear, though it be but one man.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 41:3
verses.text: Give yourself to hearing, though it be but one speaking freely, using harshness, and at the same time healing.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 41:4
verses.text: For it is good for the eyes not to continue always wanton, but to weep and smart sometimes, for greater health.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 41:5
verses.text: So also nothing is more pernicious to the soul than  uninterrupted pleasure.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 41:6
verses.text: For it is blinded by melting away, if it remain unmoved by bold speech.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 41:7
verses.text: Fear this man when angry; be pained at his groaning; and reverence him when making his anger to cease; and anticipate him when he is deprecating punishment.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 41:8
verses.text: Let him pass many sleepless nights for thee, interceding for thee with God, influencing the Father with the magic of familiar litanies.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 41:9
verses.text: For He does not hold out against His children when they beg His pity.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 41:10
verses.text: And for you he will pray purely, held in high honour as an angel of God, and grieved not by you, but for you.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 41:11
verses.text: This is sincere repentance.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 41:12
verses.text: "God is not mocked," nor does He give heed to vain words.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 41:13
verses.text: For He alone searches the marrow and reins of the heart, and hears those that are in the fire, and listens to those who supplicate in the whale's belly; and is near to all who believe, and far from the ungodly if they repent not.

chapters.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:1
verses.text: 42 And that you may be still more confident, that repenting thus truly there remains for you a sure hope of salvation, listen to a tale, which is not a tale but a narrative, handed down and committed to the custody of memory, about the Apostle John.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:2
verses.text: For when, on the tyrant's death, he returned to Ephesus from the isle of Patmos, he went away, being invited, to the contiguous territories of the nations, here to appoint bishops, there to set in order whole Churches, there to ordain such as were marked out by the Spirit.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:3
verses.text: Having come to one of the cities not far off (the name of which some give), and having put the brethren to rest in other matters, at last, looking to the bishop appointed, and seeing a youth, powerful in body, comely in appearance, and ardent, said, "This (youth) I commit to you in all earnestness, in the presence of the Church, and with Christ as witness".

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:4
verses.text: And on his accepting and promising all, he gave the same injunction and testimony.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:5
verses.text: And he set out for Ephesus.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:6
verses.text: And the presbyter taking home the youth committed to him, reared, kept, cherished, and finally baptized him.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:7
verses.text: After this he relaxed his stricter care and guardianship, under the idea that the seal of the Lord he had set on him was a complete protection to him.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:8
verses.text: But on his obtaining premature freedom, some youths of his age, idle, dissolute, and adepts in evil courses, corrupt him.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:9
verses.text: First they entice him by many costly entertainments; then afterwards by night issuing forth for highway robbery, they take him along with them.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:10
verses.text: Then they dared to execute together something greater.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:11
verses.text: And he by degrees got accustomed; and from greatness of nature, when he had gone aside from the right path, and like a hard-mouthed and powerful horse, had taken the bit between his teeth, rushed with all the more force down into the depths.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:12
verses.text: And having entirely despaired of salvation in God, he no longer meditated what was insignificant, but having perpetrated some great exploit, now that he was once lost, he made up his mind to a like fate with the rest.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:13
verses.text: Taking them and forming a band of robbers, he was the prompt captain of the bandits, the fiercest, the bloodiest, the cruelest.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:14
verses.text: Time passed, and some necessity having emerged, they send again for John.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:15
verses.text: He, when he had settled the other matters on account of which he came, said, "Come now, O bishop, restore to us the deposit which I and the Saviour committed to thee in the face of the Church over which you preside, as witness".

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:16
verses.text: The other was at first confounded, thinking that it was a false charge about money which he did not get; and he could neither believe the allegation regarding what he had not, nor disbelieve John.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:17
verses.text: But when he said "I demand the young man, and the soul of the brother," the old man, groaning deeply, and bursting into tears, said, "He is dead".

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:18
verses.text: "How and what kind of death?" "He is dead," he said, "to God.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:19
verses.text: For he turned wicked and abandoned, and at last a robber; and now he has taken possession of the mountain in front of the church, along with a band like him".

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:20
verses.text: Rending, therefore, his clothes, and striking his head with great lamentation, the apostle said, "It was a fine guard of a brother's soul I left! But let a horse be brought me, and let some one be my guide on the way".

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:21
verses.text: He rode away, just as he was, straight from the church.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:22
verses.text: On coming to the place, he is arrested by the robbers' outpost; neither fleeing nor entreating, but crying, "It was for this I came.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:23
verses.text: Lead me to your captain;" who meanwhile was waiting, all armed as he was.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:24
verses.text: But when he recognized John as he advanced, he turned, ashamed, to flight.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:25
verses.text: The other followed with all his might, forgetting his age, crying, "Why, my son, dost thou flee from me, thy father, unarmed, old? Son, pity me.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:26
verses.text: Fear not; thou hast still hope of life.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:27
verses.text: I will give account to Christ for thee.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:28
verses.text: If need be, I will willingly endure thy death, as the Lord did death for us.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:29
verses.text: For thee I will surrender my life.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:30
verses.text: Stand, believe; Christ hath sent me".

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:31
verses.text: And he, when he heard, first stood, looking down; then threw down his arms, then trembled and wept bitterly.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:32
verses.text: And on the old man approaching, he embraced him, speaking for himself with lamentations as he could, and baptized a second time with tears, concealing only his right hand.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:33
verses.text: The other pledging, and assuring him on oath that he would find forgiveness for himself from the Saviour, beseeching and falling on his knees, and kissing his right hand itself, as now  purified by repentance, led him back to the church.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:34
verses.text: Then by supplicating with copious prayers, and striving along with him in continual fastings, and subduing his mind by various utterances of words, did not depart, as they say, till he restored him to the Church, presenting in him a great example of true repentance and a great token of regeneration, a trophy of the resurrection for which we hope; when at the end of the world, the angels, radiant with joy, hymning and opening the heavens, shall receive into the celestial abodes those who truly repent; and before all, the Saviour Himself goes to meet them, welcoming them; holding forth the shadowless, ceaseless light; conducting them, to the Father's bosom, to eternal life, to the kingdom of heaven.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:35
verses.text: Let one believe these things, and the disciples of God, and God, who is surety, the Prophecies, the Gospels, the Apostolic words; living in accordance with them, and lending his ears, and practising the deeds, he shall at his decease see the end and demonstration of the truths taught.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:36
verses.text: For he who in this world welcomes the angel of penitence will not repent at the time that he leaves the body, nor be ashamed when he sees the Saviour approaching in His glory and with His army.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:37
verses.text: He fears not the fire.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:38
verses.text: But if one chooses to continue and to sin perpetually in pleasures, and values indulgence here above eternal life, and turns away from the Saviour, who gives forgiveness; let him no more blame either God, or riches, or his having fallen, but his own soul, which voluntarily perishes.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:39
verses.text: But to him who directs his eye to salvation and desires it, and asks with boldness and vehemence for its bestowal, the good Father who is in heaven will give the true purification and the changeless life.

verses.name: Clement of Alexandria: On the Salvation of the Rich Man 42:40
verses.text: To whom, by His Son Jesus Christ, the Lord of the living and dead, and by the Holy Spirit, be glory, honour, power, eternal majesty, both now and ever, from generation to generation, and from eternity to eternity, Amen.
